Description: Five joining fragments of rim, wall and handle of North Ionian pottery bird bowl (now three separate fragments). Inside glazed with added red bands lined in white; outside, bird to right; pendent ray to right of the bird, and vertical lines framing the metope; below dilute line and void rays. Inscription on exterior near rim.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'For the drawing compare birds of Coldstream's Group III, for example, from Rhodes (ClRh 6-7, 61 fig. 54; Coldstream GCP 300 no. 26) and Delos (Delos 15 pl. 48 fig. 30; Coldstream GGP 300 no. 27). The fragment also preserves the void rays common to bird-bowls of Coldstream's Group III, but shows only a faint ground line separating the bird from the rays beneath. The lack of a ground line is a feature of Coldstream's latest Group IV (after 615).'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 3, no. 5, pl. 2)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.081)
